channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Biden, Kamala Harris' joint rare appearance, pep talk amid doubt over ticket
item.description: ​Biden convened the meeting with Kamala Harris and a group of influential Democratic governors amid speculations that he may announce his decision to drop out of the re-election bid. But the meeting was like a pep talk confirming that Kamala Harris was not going to take Biden's place and Biden was not mulling to opt out either.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Vivek Ramaswamy has this advice for Democrats on 'which puppet to choose'
item.description: ​Vivek Ramaswamy, who is being seen as the Republican's VP candidate, offered a piece of advice with a banter to the Democrats as speculations are rife over Biden alternatives. The Indian-American billionaire said the more the Democrats delay choosing their 'puppet', it's best for them -- contrary to the popular belief as there will be a honeymoon period after a new candidate is picked. The Democrats' ideal situation would be the election to be held during that honeymoon period sans public scrutiny, Vivek Ramaswamy said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Biden told ally he may not be able to salvage candidacy: Report
item.description: ​President Joe Biden, despite the top Democrats now putting up a brave face publicly following the debate debacle, knows that he may not be able to salvage his candidacy if he cannot convince the public in the coming days he knows how to do the job. And he has told this to a key ally, New York Times reported. The report claimed that White House spokesperson Andrew Bates dismissed the report of Biden mulling to withdraw from the race and said it was "absolutely false".
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Before marrying Melania in 2005': What new documents claim about Trump-Epstein
item.description: ​New documents which were unreleased so far claim that Donald Trump and Jeffrey Epstein were closer than it was believed. Transcripts show Trump called Epstein many times between 2004 and 2006. The screenshots were sealed in 2008 as part of Alexander Acosta's deal for Jeffrey Epstein and were released on July 1.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Polls show Michelle Obama leading Donald Trump, sparking Democratic speculation amid Joe Biden concerns
item.description: In a surprising turn, Michelle Obama emerges as a formidable contender against Donald Trump, leading by a significant margin in recent polls. Key Democratic figures express concerns about Joe Biden's performance, prompting calls for urgent action to evaluate his candidacy. Other potential candidates show weaker polling numbers against Trump, highlighting Obama's strength in the political landscape.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: In a first, Canada appoints woman as army chief
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Meet UK's Hindu Conservative candidate Reva Gudi who is inspired by Bhagavad Gita
item.description: Dr Reva Gudi, fighting from Feltham and Heston, is inspired by Bhagavad Gita's message of detachment, she said. The Hindu candidate said Gita's messages helped her navigate in the male-dominated world of politics which she entered after a long career as an NHS GP for over 20 years. "As a Hindu woman, I do sometimes face unique challenges, including overcoming stereotypes and ensuring that my voice is heard, in predominantly, what can be a male-dominated field," she said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ivanka Trump says politics is pretty dark world but...
item.description: Melania Trump will not be a 24X7 First Lady if Donald Trump returns to the White House as she would like to spend her time with Barron Trump in New York. Donald Trump's daughter Ivanka Trump too was not seen much publicly in her father's campaigning but she said she would attend the Republican National Convention where her father would officially accept the presidential nomination from the party.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UK election: What are Labour's foreign policy plans?
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Spoilt food forces Delta flight to make emergency landing
item.description: A Delta Airlines flight with 277 passengers on board made an emergency landing in New York in the early hours Wednesday after it was found out that the fliers were served with contaminated food. The airlines regretted the incident and promised an investigation while fliers had to bear the brunt of the delay.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UN rights chief warns about rise of far-right in Europe
item.description: United Nations rights chief Volker Turk, driven by Austria's anti-semitic history, advocates for refugee protection and condemns hate speech in Europe. His stance highlights the critical role of political leaders in promoting tolerance and preventing discriminatory behavior.

item.title: 'Garbage': RFK Jr says he ate goat in viral photo, not barbequed dog
item.description: A major row erupted after an old photo of Robert F Kennedy Jr with a carcass of a four-footed animal surfaced. According to claims, Kennedy Jr was going to take a bite into the barbequed dog in the viral photo. But the 70-year-old presidential candidate rubbished the claim and said it was a goat and the photo was taken in 2010 in Patagonia, not Korea.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: At least 7 arrested in Germany and Sweden on suspicion of committing war crimes in Syria
item.description: At least seven people were arrested in Germany and Sweden on suspicion of committing crimes against humanity and war crimes in Syria between 2012 and 2014, authorities announced Wednesday. This coordinated operation involved Eurojust, Europol, and several other unnamed European countries. Four individuals were detained in Germany, while the remaining three were apprehended in Sweden. The arrests were the result of extensive cooperation among European law enforcement agencies.

item.title: Most patients have fled European Gaza Hospital: WHO
item.description: Almost all patients at the European Gaza Hospital and the Red Cross field hospital fled following Israeli military evacuation orders, according to the WHO. The evacuation orders affected the southern Gaza areas of Khan Yunis and Rafah, near the Egyptian border. The World Health Organization reported that on Monday, 270 patients and medical staff self-evacuated. On Tuesday, the Gaza health ministry continued the evacuation of more patients.

item.title: 2 men stabbed in 'terror attack' at Israeli mall
item.description: Two people were injured in a suspected "terror attack" after being stabbed at a mall in northern Israel's Karmiel on Wednesday. The Israeli police reported that the attacker was killed following the attempted fatal attack. The incident took place at an Israeli mall, where authorities responded swiftly. Medical teams attended to the injured, both men in their 20s. One of the victims sustained serious injuries while the other remained fully conscious.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Dick Schoof: The new Dutch PM with intelligence roots

item.title: Record-breaking temperatures strengthen Hurricane Beryl as it hits Caribbean

item.title: Pakistan arming JF-17 jets with Ra'ad nuke missiles
item.description: A recent image from the 2023 Pakistan Day Parade rehearsals revealed a JF-17 Thunder Block II aircraft carrying a Ra'ad-I air-launched cruise missile, marking its first public observation. This indicates Pakistan's progress in equipping JF-17s for nuclear capabilities, potentially replacing the ageing Mirage III/Vs. The development occurs amid regional nuclear arms competition and heightened tensions between Pakistan, India, and China.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: Taiwan says China seizes fishing boat near its coast
item.description: China views democratically governed Taiwan as its own territory and has ramped up pressure on Taipei since May when President Lai Ching-te took office, a man Beijing accuses of being a "separatist".

item.title: China leading generative AI patents race, UN report says
